place.name: HACCONBY
place.gazetteerText: HACCONBY, or HACKENBY, a township and a parish in Bourn district, Lincoln. The township lies on Carr dyke, 4 miles N of Bourn r. station. Pop., 318. Houses, 67. The parish includes also the hamlet of Stainfield; and its post town is Bourn. Acres, 3, 220. Real property, £4, 356. Pop., 408. Houses. 85. The manor belongs to Lord Aveland. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the vicarage of Morton, in the diocese of Lincoln. The church is partly early English; consists of nave, aisle, and chancel; and has a tower and spire. Charities, £9. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
